page.title: 16THE ALMS HOUSES
page.content: " The alms houses were built in 1896" "by M.P.Hugh Boscowen. The purpose" "being to house poor housekeepers , who "must be over sixty and have lived in a "2 mile radius of Tregony for 2 years." "The occupants are all senior citizens" "and consist of two gentlemen and four" "ladies." " The alms houses were rebuilt in 1895 "and in 1943 electricity was put in and" "between 1944-1945 were used to house" "evacuees." " It is owned by the Hugh Boscowen" "Charity, run by a trust, one trustee" "is always a Tregony congregation" "church member. Mr Colin Brown is" "clerk treasurer and gets a small" "salary." " The people used to have to work" "to earn their keep, now this does not" "apply." " "
